summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling its primary responsibility for international peace and security,

Recognizing medals presented to UN personnel serving in field operations,

Establishes the "Captain Mbaye Diagne Medal for Exceptional Courage" to honor military, police, civilian, and associated personnel demonstrating exceptional courage in the face of extreme danger while fulfilling their UN mandates.

The medal will be awarded to those who show exceptional courage in the service of humanity and the UN.

The Secretary-General is requested to:

- Establish the medal's design within six months,
- Submit modalities for recipient nomination and selection,

The medal will be presented by the Secretary-General in a ceremony to which all UN member states are invited.

The medal will be ready for investiture within six months of establishing its modalities, with administrative management provided by the Secretariat.
